009package imagingbook.common.ransac;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.List;
013import java.util.Random;
014
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Primitive2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogLabel;
020import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
021
022/**
023 * Generic RANSAC detector for 2D primitives. This abstract class defines the core RANSAC
024 * functionality used by all derived (concrete) classes.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * 
028 * @see RansacLineDetector
029 * @see RansacCircleDetector
030 * @see RansacEllipseDetector
031 * @see Primitive2d
032 *
033 * @param <T> generic type extending {@link Primitive2d}
034 */
035public abstract class RansacDetector<T extends Primitive2d> {
036        
037        /**
038         * Parameters used by all RANSAC types.
039         */
040        public static class RansacParameters implements ParameterBundle {
041                        
042                /** The number of iterations (random point draws) to use in each detection cycle.*/
043                @DialogLabel("Number of random draws") 
044                public int randomPointDraws = 1000;
045                
046                /** The maximum distance of any point from the curve to be considered an "inlier".*/
047                @DialogLabel("Max. inlier distance") 
048                public double maxInlierDistance = 2.0;
049                
050                /** The minimum number of inliers required for successful detection.*/
051                @DialogLabel("Min. inlier count") 
052                public int minInlierCount = 100;
053                
054                /** Set true to remove inlier points after each detection.*/
055                @DialogLabel("Remove inliers") 
056                public boolean removeInliers = true;
057                
058                /** Random seed used initialization (0 = no seed).*/
059                @DialogLabel("Random seed (0 = no seed)") 
060                public int randomSeed = 0;
061        }
062        
063        // -----------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        private final RansacParameters params;
066        private final int K;                                            // number of points to draw
067        private final RandomDraw<Pnt2d> randomDraw;     // 
068        
069        RansacDetector(int K, RansacParameters params) {
070                this.K = K;
071                this.params = params;
072                Random rand = (params.randomSeed == 0) ? null : new Random(params.randomSeed);
073                this.randomDraw = new RandomDraw<>(rand);
074        }
075        
076        // -----------------------------------------------------------
077        
078//      /**
079//       * Returns this detector's random generator. This can be used, e.g.,
080//       * to set its seed (by {@link Random#setSeed(long)}).
081//       * 
082//       * @return the random generator
083//       */
084//      public Random getRandom() {
085//              return this.rand;
086//      }
087        
088        // ----------------------------------------------------------
089        
090        /**
091         * Performs iterative RANSAC steps on the supplied image,
092         * which is assumed to be binary (all nonzero pixels are considered
093         * input points).
094         * Extracts the point set from the image and calls {@link #detectAll(Pnt2d[], int)}.
095         * 
096         * @param bp a binary image (nonzero pixels are considered points)
097         * @param maxCount the maximum number of primitives to detect
098         * @return the list of detected primitives
099         */
100        public List<RansacResult<T>> detectAll(ByteProcessor bp, int maxCount) {
101                Pnt2d[] points = IjUtils.collectNonzeroPoints(bp);
102                if (points.length == 0) {
103                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("empty point set");
104                }
105                return detectAll(points, maxCount);
106        }
107        
108        /**
109         * Performs iterative RANSAC steps on the supplied point set until
110         * either no more primitive was detected or the maximum number
111         * of primitives was reached.
112         * Iteratively calls {@link #detectNext(Pnt2d[])} on the specified
113         * point set.
114         * 
115         * @param points the original point set
116         * @param maxCount the maximum number of primitives to detect
117         * @return the list of detected primitives
118         */
119        public List<RansacResult<T>> detectAll(Pnt2d[] points, int maxCount) {
120                List<RansacResult<T>> primitives = new ArrayList<>();
121                int cnt = 0;
122                
123                RansacResult<T> sol = detectNext(points);
124                while (sol != null && cnt < maxCount) {
125                        primitives.add(sol);
126                        cnt = cnt + 1;
127                        sol = detectNext(points);
128                }
129                return primitives;
130        }
131        
132        /**
133         * Performs a single RANSAC step on the supplied point set. 
134         * If {@link RansacParameters#removeInliers} is set true, 
135         * all associated inlier points are removed from the point set (by setting
136         * array elements to {@code null}).
137         * 
138         * @param points an array of {@link Pnt2d} instances (modified)
139         * @return the detected primitive (of generic type T) or {@code null} if unsuccessful
140         */
141        public RansacResult<T> detectNext(Pnt2d[] points) {
142                Pnt2d[] drawInit = null;
143                double scoreInit = -1;
144                T primitiveInit = null;
145                
146                for (int i = 0; i < params.randomPointDraws; i++) {
147                        Pnt2d[] draw = drawRandomPoints(points);
148                        T primitive = fitInitial(draw);
149                        if (primitive == null) {
150                                continue;
151                        }
152                        double score = countInliers(primitive, points);
153                        if (score >= params.minInlierCount && score > scoreInit) {
154                                scoreInit = score;
155                                drawInit = draw;
156                                primitiveInit = primitive;
157                        }
158                }
159                
160                if (primitiveInit == null) {
161                        return null;
162                }
163                else {
164                        // refit the primitive to all inliers:
165                        Pnt2d[] inliers = collectInliers(primitiveInit, points);
166                        T primitiveFinal = fitFinal(inliers);   
167                        if (primitiveFinal != null)
168                                return new RansacResult<T>(drawInit, primitiveInit, primitiveFinal, scoreInit, inliers);
169                        else
170                                throw new RuntimeException("final fit failed!");
171                }
172        }
173        
174        /**
175         * Randomly selects {@link #K} unique points from the supplied {@link Pnt2d} array.
176         * Inheriting classes may override this method to enforce specific constraints 
177         * on the selected points (e.g., see {@link RansacLineDetector}).
178         * 
179         * @param points an array of {@link Pnt2d} instances
180         * @return an array of {@link #K} unique points
181         */
182        Pnt2d[] drawRandomPoints(Pnt2d[] points) {      
183                return randomDraw.drawFrom(points, K);
184        }
185        
186        private int countInliers(T curve, Pnt2d[] points) {
187                int count = 0;
188                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
189                        if (p != null) {
190                                double d = curve.getDistance(p);
191                                if (d < params.maxInlierDistance) {
192                                        count++;
193                                }
194                        }
195                }
196                return count;
197        }
198        
199        /**
200         * Find all points that are considered inliers with respect to the
201         * specified curve and the value of {@link RansacParameters#maxInlierDistance}.
202         * If {@link RansacParameters#removeInliers} is set true, these
203         * points are also removed from the original point set, otherwise
204         * they remain.
205         * 
206         * @param curve
207         * @param points
208         * @return
209         */
210        private Pnt2d[] collectInliers(Primitive2d curve, Pnt2d[] points) {
211                List<Pnt2d> pList = new ArrayList<>();
212                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
213                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
214                        if (p != null) {
215                                double d = curve.getDistance(p);
216                                if (d < params.maxInlierDistance) {
217                                        pList.add(p);
218                                        if (params.removeInliers) {
219                                                points[i] = null;
220                                        }
221                                }
222                        }
223                }
224                return pList.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
225        }
226        
227        // abstract methods to be implemented by specific sub-classes: -----------------------
228        
229        /**
230         * Fits an initial primitive to the specified points.
231         * This abstract method must be implemented by inheriting classes,
232         * which must also specify the required number of initial points ({@link #K}).
233         * 
234         * @param draw an array of exactly {@link #K} points
235         * @return a new primitive of type T
236         */
237        abstract T fitInitial(Pnt2d[] draw);
238        
239        /**
240         * Fits a primitive to the specified points.
241         * This abstract method must be implemented by inheriting classes.
242         * 
243         * @param inliers an array of at least {@link #K} points
244         * @return a new primitive of type T.
245         */
246        abstract T fitFinal(Pnt2d[] inliers);
247        
248}
